paper_id.78: (Dis)Engagement Matters: Identifying Efficacious Learning Practices with Multimodal Learning Analytics
paper_id.79: Unraveling Students’ Interaction Around a Tangible Interface Using Multimodal Learning Analytics
paper_id.80: Leveraging mobile eye-trackers to capture joint visual attention in co-located collaborative learning groups
paper_id.81: Does Seeing One Another’s Gaze Affect Group Dialogue? A Computational Approach
paper_id.82: Real-time mutual gaze perception enhances collaborative 4 learning and collaboration quality
paper_id.83: Challenging Joint Visual Attention as a Proxy for Collaborative Performance
paper_id.84: Deep neural networks for collaborative learning analytics: Evaluating team collaborations using student gaze point prediction
paper_id.85: Towards Collaborative Convergence: Quantifying Collaboration Quality with Automated Co-located Collaboration Analytics
paper_id.86: Joint attention behaviour in remote collaborative problem solving: exploring different attentional levels in dyadic interaction
paper_id.87: Phases of collaborative mathematical problem solving and joint attention: a case study utilizing mobile gaze tracking
paper_id.88: Measuring causality between collaborative and individual gaze metrics for collaborative problem-solving with intelligent tutoring systems
paper_id.89: Dyadic joint visual attention interaction in face-to-face collaborative problem-solving at K-12 Maths Education: A Multimodal Approach
paper_id.90: Brain-to-Brain Synchrony Tracks Real-World Dynamic Group Interactions in the Classroom
paper_id.91: Exploring Adaptation in Socially-Shared Regulation of Learning Using Video and Heart Rate Data
paper_id.92: Utilizing Interactive Surfaces to Enhance Learning, Collaboration and Engagement: Insights from Learners’ Gaze and Speech
paper_id.93: A Multimodal Exploration of Engineering Students Emotions and Electrodermal Activity in Design Activities
paper_id.94: Multimodal, Multiparty Modeling of Collaborative Problem Solving Performance
paper_id.95: Temporal analysis of multimodal data to predict collaborative learning outcomes
paper_id.96: Collaboration on Procedural Problems May Support Conceptual Knowledge More than You May Think
paper_id.97: An Application of Extreme Value Theory to Learning Analytics: Predicting Collaboration Outcome from Eye-Tracking Data
paper_id.98: Using Dual Eye-Tracking to Evaluate Students' Collaboration with an Intelligent Tutoring System for Elementary-Level Fractions
